definition: stretch a hand and grab it (idiom); very easy
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)
to capture
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: You thought your victory was inevitable, but you were wrong.
sentences.chinese: 你以爲你的勝利手到擒來，但是你錯了。

sentences.english: The beautiful wife is as inevitable as the mistresses.
sentences.chinese: 對他來說，娶得美妻就像搞情人一樣手到擒來。

sentences.english: Languages come easily to some people.
sentences.chinese: 語言學習對有些人來說手到擒來。

sentences.english: Sir Alex knows victory over Fulham is far from a formality.
sentences.chinese: 弗爵爺知道對富勒姆的勝利，並非手到擒來。

sentences.english: Ms Suu Kyi says that she herself will contest one of the seats up for grabs.
sentences.chinese: 素姬女士說她將爭取一個手到擒來的議會席位。

definition: men and women should not touch hands when they give or receive things (citation, from Mencius)
pinyin: nan2 nu:3 shou4 shou4 bu4 qin1

definition: foolish talk/nonsense
to behave unscrupulously
keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
see 領盒飯|领盒饭[ling3 he2 fan4]
shouting abuse in the street like a fishwife
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
wealthy son-in-law/wealthy husband
variant of 敢做敢當|敢做敢当[gan3 zuo4 gan3 dang1]
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
female gossip/busybody
lit. Lord Ye's passion for dragons (idiom)/fig. to pretend to be fond of sth while actually fearing it/ostensible fondness of sth one really fears
to boast
